title: Setting batch_cfg=True produces slightly different results
body:
Hi, I was playing around with `batch_cfg` and am seeing different results when I enable/disable batching. Is this intended behaviour?

Code to reproduce:
```py
import numpy as np
import os
from genmo.mochi_preview.pipelines import (
    DecoderModelFactory,
    DitModelFactory,
    MochiPipeline,
    T5ModelFactory,
    linear_quadratic_schedule,
)

import pickle

MOCHI_DIR = "./weights"

pipeline = MochiPipeline(
    text_encoder_factory=T5ModelFactory(),
    dit_factory=DitModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/dit.safetensors", model_dtype="bf16"
    ),
    decoder_factory=DecoderModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/decoder.safetensors",
    ),
    decode_type="tiled_full",
    cpu_offload=True
)

cfgs = [
    (dict(
        height=480,
        width=848,
        num_frames=31,
        num_inference_steps=64,
        sigma_schedule=linear_quadratic_schedule(64, 0.025),
        cfg_schedule=[4.5] * 64,
        batch_cfg=False,
        prompt="A spinning globe on a wooden desk.",
        negative_prompt="",
        seed=12345,
    ), "ref_unbatched.pkl"),
    (dict(
        height=480,
        width=848,
        num_frames=31,
        num_inference_steps=64,
        sigma_schedule=linear_quadratic_schedule(64, 0.025),
        cfg_schedule=[4.5] * 64,
        batch_cfg=True,
        prompt="A spinning globe on a wooden desk.",
        negative_prompt="",
        seed=12345,
    ), "ref_batched.pkl")
]

videos = []
for cfg, fname in cfgs:
    video = pipeline(**cfg)
    videos.append(video)
        
print(np.allclose(videos[0], videos[1]))
```

Note: The generated videos look roughly the same
author: Akshat-Tripathi

comments.body:
Hi @Akshat-Tripathi,

Do you have any visual examples comparing the two videos?

Some slight numerical differences are expected between batch_cfg=False and batch_cfg=True due to CUDA kernel differences in the framework.

If there's a significant difference in the videos, we'd be happy to check for a bug.

title: TypeError: configure_model() missing 1 required positional argument: 'cpu_offload_'
body:
TypeError: configure_model() missing 1 required positional argument: 'cpu_offload_'
start gradio
I will encounter this problem regardless of whether I pass this parameter or not
Here are some startup parameters I have tried
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload true
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload false
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/
author: ysxk

comments.body: Hi @ysxk, this is a bug introduced by our LoRA trainer. I'm working on a fix which should be out soon. In the meantime, `./demos/cli.py` works. Thanks for reporting!

@ysxk gradio_ui.py is now fixed. You can use it with:
```
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload
```
or
```
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/
```
